Text: SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING UNTIL PM CT SATURDAY MAY FOR THUNDERSTORM WARNING NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HOUSTONGALVESTON TX PM CDT SAT MAY THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS ISSUED A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHERN HARRIS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS UNTIL PM CDT AT PM CDTDOPPLER RADAR INDICATED A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM MILES NORTHWEST OF SPRINGMOVING SOUTH AT MPH LOCATIONS IN THE PATH OF THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM INCLUDE HOOKS AIRPORT SPRING BUSHINTERCONTINENTAL AIRPORTHUMBLE ALDINE MOVE TO AN INTERIOR ROOM ON THE LOWEST FLOOR OF YOUR HOME OR BUSINESS STAY AWAY FROM WINDOWS PLEASE REPORT SEVERE WEATHER TO THE COUNTY SHERIFFLOCAL POLICE OR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY THEY WILL RELAY YOUR REPORT TO THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE

SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING UNTIL PM CT FRIDAY MAY FOR THUNDERSTORM WARNING NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HOUSTONGALVESTON TX PM CDT FRI MAY THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS ISSUED A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR HARRIS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS UNTIL PM CDT AT PM CDTDOPPLER RADAR INDICATED A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM OVER SPRING VALLEYMOVING NORTHWEST AT MPH LOCATIONS IN THE PATH OF THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM INCLUDE SPRING VALLEYHEDWIG VILLAGEHILSHIRE VILLAGEHUNTERS CREEK VILLAGE ADDICKS JERSEY VILLAGE MOVE TO AN INTERIOR ROOM ON THE LOWEST FLOOR OF YOUR HOME OR BUSINESS STAY AWAY FROM WINDOWS PLEASE REPORT SEVERE WEATHER TO THE COUNTY SHERIFFLOCAL POLICE OR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY THEY WILL RELAY YOUR REPORT TO THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LATLON

FLOOD WARNING UNTIL MON DEC AM CST FOR FLOOD STATEMENT NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HOUSTONGALVESTON TX PM CST SUN DEC A RIVER FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR THE LUCE BAYOUTRINITY RIVER FOR THE TRINITY RIVER NEAR MOSS BLUFF MAJOR FLOODING IS OCCURRING WITH A STAGE OF FEET TONIGHT FLOOD STAGE IS FEET THE RIVER IS EXPECTED TO HAVE A FLAT CREST AROUND FEET THIS EARLY MONDAY THEN BEGIN A SLOW FALL TUESDAY BUT REMAIN ABOVE FLOOD STAGE THIS WEEK FOR THE LUCE BAYOU NEAR HUFFMAN THE STAGE WAS FEET TONIGHT FLOOD STAGE IS FEET THE RIVER IS EXPECTED TO FALL BELOW FLOOD STAGE MONDAY MORNING PERSONS ARE URGED TO STAY AWAY FROM THE RIVER UNTIL WATER LEVELS RECEDE MOTORISTS SHOULD AVOID ANY WATER COVERED ROADS AND FIND AN ALTERNATE ROUTE DO NOT DRIVE YOUR CAR THROUGH FLOODED ROADWAYS THE DEPTH AND WATER VELOCITY COULD BE TOO GREAT FOR YOU TO CROSS SAFELYLIVESTOCK AND EQUIPMENT SHOULD REMAIN OUT OF THE FLOOD PLAIN FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS STAY TUNED TO NOAA WEATHER RADIO OR OTHER NEWS SOURCES FOR FURTHER UPDATES

FLOOD WARNING UNTIL MON DEC PM CST FOR FLOOD STATEMENTCORRECTED TO ADD LUCE BAYOU AND PEACH CREEK NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HOUSTONGALVESTON TX AM CST MON DEC A RIVER FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR THE TRINITY RIVERPEACH CREEKAND LUCE BAYOU THE RIVER FLOOD WARNING FOR MIDDLE YEGUA CREEK IS DISCONTINUED FOR THE TRINITY RIVER NEAR MOSS BLUFF MAJOR FLOODING IS OCCURRING WITH A STAGE OF FEET LATE THIS MORNING FLOOD STAGE IS FEET THE RIVER IS NEAR CREST NOW AND IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN A VERY SLOW FALL TUESDAY FOR PEACH CREEK NEAR SPLENDORA MINOR FLOODING IS OCCURRING WITH A STAGE OF FEET THIS MORNING FLOOD STAGE IS FEET THE CREEK IS EXPECTED TO CREST NEAR FEET THIS AFTERNOON AND THEN BEGIN A SLOW FALL FOR LUCE BAYOU NEAR HUFFMAN THE STAGE WAS FEET LATE THIS MORNING FLOOD STAGE IS FEET THE BAYOU IS EXPECTED TO FALL BELOW FLOOD STAGE TONIGHT FOR MIDDLE YEGUA CREEK NEAR DIME BOX THE STAGE WAS FEET THIS MORNING FLOOD STAGE IS FEET THE CREEK IS EXPECTED TO CREST NEAR FEET THIS AFTERNOON PERSONS ARE URGED TO STAY AWAY FROM THE RIVER UNTIL WATER LEVELS RECEDE MOTORISTS SHOULD AVOID ANY WATER COVERED ROADS AND FIND AN ALTERNATE ROUTE DO NOT DRIVE YOUR CAR THROUGH FLOODED ROADWAYS THE DEPTH AND WATER VELOCITY COULD BE TOO GREAT FOR YOU TO CROSS SAFELYLIVESTOCK AND EQUIPMENT SHOULD REMAIN OUT OF THE FLOOD PLAIN FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS STAY TUNED TO NOAA WEATHER RADIO OR OTHER NEWS SOURCES FOR FURTHER UPDATES

SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING UNTIL PM CT FRIDAY MAY FOR THUNDERSTORM WARNING NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HOUSTONGALVESTON TX PM CDT FRI MAY THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS ISSUED A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR HARRIS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS UNTIL PM CDT AT PM CDTDOPPLER RADAR INDICATED A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM OVER SPRING VALLEYMOVING NORTHWEST AT MPH LOCATIONS IN THE PATH OF THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM INCLUDE SPRING VALLEYHEDWIG VILLAGEHILSHIRE VILLAGEHUNTERS CREEK VILLAGE ADDICKS JERSEY VILLAGE MOVE TO AN INTERIOR ROOM ON THE LOWEST FLOOR OF YOUR HOME OR BUSINESS STAY AWAY FROM WINDOWS PLEASE REPORT SEVERE WEATHER TO THE COUNTY SHERIFFLOCAL POLICE OR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY THEY WILL RELAY YOUR REPORT TO THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LATLON

SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING UNTIL PM CT SATURDAY MAY FOR THUNDERSTORM WARNING NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HOUSTONGALVESTON TX PM CDT SAT MAY THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS ISSUED A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHERN HARRIS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS UNTIL PM CDT AT PM CDTDOPPLER RADAR INDICATED A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM MILES NORTHWEST OF SPRINGMOVING SOUTH AT MPH LOCATIONS IN THE PATH OF THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM INCLUDE HOOKS AIRPORT SPRING BUSHINTERCONTINENTAL AIRPORTHUMBLE ALDINE MOVE TO AN INTERIOR ROOM ON THE LOWEST FLOOR OF YOUR HOME OR BUSINESS STAY AWAY FROM WINDOWS PLEASE REPORT SEVERE WEATHER TO THE COUNTY SHERIFFLOCAL POLICE OR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY THEY WILL RELAY YOUR REPORT TO THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE

WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL TUE JAN AM CST FOR AUSTINBRAZOSBURLESONCOLORADOFORT BENDGRIMESHARRISHOUSTON LIBERTYMADISONMONTGOMERYPOLKSAN JACINTOTRINITYWALKERWALLER WASHINGTONWHARTON INCLUDING THE CITIES OFBRENHAMBRYANCOLLEGE STATION CALDWELLCOLDSPRINGCOLUMBUSCONROECROCKETTEL CAMPO WHARTONGROVETONTRINITYHEMPSTEADHOUSTONPASADENA HUNTSVILLELIBERTYLIVINGSTONCORRIGANMADISONVILLE NAVASOTARICHMONDSUGARLANDSEALYBELLVILLE PM CST MON DEC WINTER STORM WATCH TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT LIGHT RAIN IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER SOUTHEAST TEXAS LATE TONIGHT OR EARLY TUESDAY THE RAIN MAY BE MIXED INITIALLY WITH SNOWSLEET OR FREEZING RAIN ALONG AND NORTH OF A LINE FROM LAKE LIVINGSTON TO BRENHAM COLD AIR WILL DRAIN SOUTHWARD AS THE PRECIPITATION CONTINUES TO DEVELOPAND A CHANGEOVER TO SNOW OR SLEET IS EXPECTED DURING THE DAY TUESDAY PRECIPITATION COULD CHANGE TO SNOW OR SLEET EVEN AS FAR SOUTH AS METRO HOUSTON BY DAYS END TUESDAY OR EARLY TUESDAY EVENING EXACT SNOW AND SLEET AMOUNTS ARE DIFFICULT TO PINPOINT AT THIS TIME BUT ESPECIALLY NORTH OF THE HOUSTONTWO INCHES OR MORE COULD ACCUMULATE BY THE TIME THE PRECIPITATION TAPERS OFF LATE TUESDAY NIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL BE RIGHT AROUND THE FREEZING MARK TOMORROW OVER NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE WATCH AREAIN SPOTS SUCH AS CROCKETT HUNTSVILLEAND COLLEGE STATION TEMPERATURES SHOULD REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING IN METRO HOUSTON UNTIL SUNSETTHEN FALL BELOW FREEZING DURING THE EVENING MOTORISTS SHOULD BE ALERT FOR DETERIORATING DRIVING CONDITIONS TOMORROW AND TOMORROW NIGHT EVEN IN METRO HOUSTONDRIVING COULD BECOME DANGEROUSESPECIALLY TOMORROW NIGHT WHEN TEMPERATURES FALL BELOW FREEZING ANY LIQUID LEFT ON ROADS WILL FREEZEESPECIALLY ON LIGHTLY TRAVELLED SECONDARY ROADS THE INCLEMENT WEATHER IS BEING CAUSED BY A STRONG UPPER LEVEL STORM SYSTEM THAT IS FORECAST TO CROSS THE REGION TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT THE SYSTEM IS FAST MOVING AND SHOULD BE EAST OF THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY MORNING TEMPERATURES WILL RISE ABOVE FREEZING OVER THE ENTIRE AREA WEDNESDAYALLOWING ANY ACCUMULATED SNOW AND SLEET TO MELT VERY COLD TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED WEDNESDAY NIGHT ANY WET AREAS LEFT ON ROADS WILL FREEZE HARD AS TEMPERATURES FALL INTO THE TO DEGREE RANGE INLAND YOU MAY WISH TO CONSIDER MAKING PREPARATIONS TO WRAP EXPOSED PIPES AND ARRANGE FOR PETS AND PORTABLE PLANTS TO BE BROUGHT INSIDE STAY TUNED TO NOAA WEATHER RADIO AND LOCAL MEDIA FOR THE LATEST FORECAST FROM THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE A WINTER STORM WATCH MEANS WINTER WEATHER IS POSSIBLENOT A CERTAINTY IF WINTER WEATHER BECOMES IMMINENTA WINTER STORM WARNING OR WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL BE ISSUED AVOID DRIVING IF WINTER WEATHER BECOMES IMMINENT

WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL TUE JAN PM CST FOR AUSTINBRAZOSBURLESONCOLORADOFORT BENDGRIMESHARRISHOUSTON LIBERTYMADISONMONTGOMERYPOLKSAN JACINTOTRINITYWALKERWALLER WASHINGTONWHARTON INCLUDING THE CITIES OFBRENHAMBRYANCOLLEGE STATION CALDWELLCOLDSPRINGCOLUMBUSCONROECROCKETTEL CAMPO WHARTONGROVETONTRINITYHEMPSTEADHOUSTONPASADENA HUNTSVILLELIBERTYLIVINGSTONCORRIGANMADISONVILLE NAVASOTARICHMONDSUGARLANDSEALYBELLVILLE AM CST TUE JAN WINTER STORM WATCH TODAY AND TONIGHT LIGHT RAIN WILL DEVELOP OVER SOUTHEAST TEXAS TODAY THE RAIN WILL CHANGE OVER TO SNOW AS THE DEPTH OF THE ARCTIC COLD AIR INCREASES OVER THE REGION COLD AIR WILL DRAIN SOUTHWARD AS THE PRECIPITATION CONTINUES TO DEVELOP SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER AREAS NORTH OF A LINE FROM BRENHAM TO LIVINGSTON THIS MORNING SNOW SHOULD BE ON THE INCREASE THIS AFTERNOON AS FAR SOUTH AS THE INTERSTATE CORRIDOR SLEET WILL BE POSSIBLE SOUTH OF INTERSTATE MAINLY LATE THIS AFTERNOON EXACT SNOW AND SLEET AMOUNTS ARE DIFFICULT TO PINPOINT AT THIS TIME ONE TO TWO INCHES COULD ACCUMULATE BY WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR AREAS GENERALLY ALONG AND NORTH OF A BELLVILLE TO HUNTSVILLE TO LIVINGSTON LINEAMOUNTS OF INCH OR LESS SOUTH TO INTERSTATE NO SIGINFICANT ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED OVER THE COASTAL COUNTIES THE SNOW SHOULD COME TO END LATE TONIGHT OR EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING AS THE TEMPERATURES FALL THE THREAT OF WATER BEGINNING TO FREEZE ON ROADWAYS WILL INCREASE THROUGHOUT THE AFTERNOON FROM NORTH TO SOUTHBY EVENING WATER ON ROADWAYS MAY FREEZE AS FAR SOUTH AS A WHARTON TO HOUSTON TO WINNIE LINEESPECIALLY ON ELEVATED ROADWAYS AND BRIDGES PERSONS WITH AUTOMATIC SPRINKLERS SHOULD TURN THEM OFF TO AVOID SPRAYING WATER ON TO THE ROADWAYS IN TURN AGGRAVATING THE THREAT OF ICY ROADWAYS MOTORISTS SHOULD BE ALERT FOR DETERIORATING DRIVING CONDITIONS THROUGHOUT THE DAY AND NIGHT EVEN IN METRO HOUSTONDRIVING COULD BECOME DANGEROUS ANY LIQUID LEFT ON ROADS WILL FREEZEESPECIALLY ON LIGHTLY TRAVELLED SECONDARY ROADS THE INCLEMENT WEATHER IS BEING CAUSED BY A STRONG UPPER LEVEL STORM SYSTEM THAT IS FORECAST TO CROSS THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT THE SYSTEM IS FAST MOVING AND SHOULD BE EAST OF THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY MORNING TEMPERATURES WILL RISE ABOVE FREEZING OVER THE ENTIRE AREA WEDNESDAY MORNINGALLOWING ANY ACCUMULATED SNOW AND SLEET TO MELT VERY COLD TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED WEDNESDAY NIGHT ANY WET AREAS LEFT ON ROADS WILL FREEZE HARD AS TEMPERATURES FALL INTO THE TO INLAND AND NEAR ON THE IMMEDIATE COAST YOU MAY WISH TO CONSIDER MAKING PREPARATIONS TO WRAP EXPOSED PIPES AND ARRANGE FOR PETS AND PORTABLE PLANTS TO BE BROUGHT INSIDE STAY TUNED TO NOAA WEATHER RADIO AND LOCAL MEDIA FOR THE LATEST FORECAST FROM THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE A WINTER STORM WARNING MAY BE ISSUED LATE TODAY IF THE THREAT OF SIGNIFICANT WINTER WEATHER INCREASES

FLASH FLOOD WARNING UNTIL AM CT WEDNESDAY JUNE FOR FLASH FLOOD WARNING NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HOUSTONGALVESTON TX AM CDT WED JUN THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS ISSUED A FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR SAN JACINTO COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS WALKER COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS GALVESTON COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS POLK COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS HARRIS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS MONTGOMERY COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS LIBERTY COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS CHAMBERS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS TRINITY COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS UNTIL AM CDT AT AM CDTFLOODING WAS ONGOING IN SOME AREAS OF HARRIS AND GALVESTON COUNTIES RADAR INDICATED THAT THE HEAVIEST RAINFALL ASSOCIATED WITH TROPICAL STORM ALLISON MOVED NORTH INTO MONTGOMERYNORTHERN LIBERTYPOLKSAN JACINTOTRINITY AND WALKER COUNTIES THIS AREA WILL LIKELY DRIFT NORTH OVERNIGHT INTO HOUSTON COUNTY TOTAL RAINFALL ACCUMULATIONS IN SOUTHEAST HARRIS AND GALVESTON COUNTIES HAVE EXCEEDED INCHES AT MANY LOCATIONS WITH SOME TOTALS OF INCHES ALONG CLEAR CREEK AND INCHES IN SANTA FE OVERNIGHT ADDITIONAL RAINFALL OF TO INCHES WILL BE COMMONPLACE WITH SOME AREAS RECEIVING TO INCHES IN THE WARNED AREA MAINLY IN MONTGOMERYSAN JACINTOPOLKAND TRINITY COUNTIES THIS IS A VERY DANGEROUS SITUATIONDO NOT ATTEMPT TO TRAVEL UNLESS ABSOLUTELY NECESSARYDO NOT CROSS ANY LOCATION WHERE WATER COVERS THE ROAD SMALL CREEKSSTREAMSBAYOUSUNDERPASSESAND FEEDER ROADS FLOOD QUICKLY USE EXTRA CAUTION AT NIGHT WHEN IT IS HARDER TO RECOGNIZE THE DEPTH AND SPEED OF FLASH FLOOD WATERS PLEASE REPORT FLOODING TO THE COUNTY SHERIFFLOCAL POLICEOR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY THEY WILL RELAY YOUR REPORT TO THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LATLON

FLASH FLOOD WARNING UNTIL AM CT WEDNESDAY JUNE FOR FLASH FLOOD WARNING NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HOUSTONGALVESTON TX PM CDT TUE JUN THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS ISSUED A FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR GALVESTON COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS HARRIS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS MONTGOMERY COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS UNTIL AM CDT AT PM CDTDOPPLER RADAR INDICATED VERY HEAVY RAINFALL OVER PORTIONS OF HARRIS AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES RAINFALL RATES OF TO INCHES PER HOUR WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE STRONGER STORMS FLOODING IS EXPECTED IN OR NEARHOUSTONALDINEHUMBLENEW CANEYCONROE AND THE WOODLANDS ALTHOUGH THE RAIN HAS DIMINISHED OVER NORTHERN GALVESTON COUNTY VERY HEAVY RAIN HAS FLOODED THE AREA AND FLOOD WATERS HAVE YET TO RECEDE ADDITIONAL RAINBANDS DEVELOPING OVER THE GULF MAY IMPACT GALVESTON COUNTY BY MIDNIGHT SMALL CREEKSSTREAMSBAYOUSUNDERPASSESAND FEEDER ROADS MAY FLOOD QUICKLY AVOID LOCATIONS WATER COVERS THE GROUND USE EXTRA CAUTION AT NIGHT WHEN IT IS HARDER TO RECOGNIZE THE DEPTH AND SPEED OF FLASH FLOOD WATERS PLEASE REPORT FLOODING TO THE COUNTY SHERIFFLOCAL POLICEOR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY THEY WILL RELAY YOUR REPORT TO THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LATLON

FLASH FLOOD WARNING UNTIL AM GMT WEDNESDAY JUNE FOR FLASH FLOOD WARNING NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HOUSTONGALVESTON UNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS HARRIS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS UNTIL PM CDT AT PM CDTDOPPLER RADAR INDICATED VERY HEAVY RAINFAL HARRIS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS UNTIL PM CDT AT PM CDTDOPPLER RADAR INDICATED VERY HEAVY RAINFALL CONTINUING OVER NORTHERN GALVESTON AND SOUTHERN HARRIS COUNTIES RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF TO INCHES PER HOUR WILL CONTINUE IN THESE AREAS FOR THE NEXT FEW HOURS FLOODING IS EXPECTED IN OR NEAR DOWNTOWN HOUSTONLEAGUE CITYPASADENASANTA FE CLEAR LAKEFRIENDSWOODSOUTHEAST HOUSTON TRAVEL IS NOT RECOMMENDED IN THESE AREAS THIS EVENING THE CIRCULATION WITH TROPICAL STORM ALLISON HAS BECOME NEARLY STATIONARY TREMENDOUS RAINFALL AMOUNTS AND SEVERE FLOODING ARE POSSIBLE OVER HARRIS AND GALVESTON COUNTIES BY LATE TONIGHT REPORTS OF FLOODING AND ROAD CLOSURES SO FAR INCLUDE ROADS IN SANTA FE ARE FLOODED FM IS IMPASSABLE BETWEEN HIGHWAY AND I FM HAS HIGH WATER AT HIGHWAY WEST BOUND LANES OF BAY AREA BOULEVARD IS CLOSED BETWEEN I AND HIGHWAY IN LEAGUE CITYSEVERAL SUBDIVISIONS ALONG FM WEST OF I ARE UNDER WATER AND IMPASSABLE MANY ROADS IN FRIENDSWOOD ARE ALSO FLOODED SAVE YOUR LIFE DO NOT DRIVE ACROSS A FLOODED ROADWAY SIGNIFICANT FLOODING IS OCCURRING ALONG I BETWEEN HOBBY AIRPORT AND THE CLEAR LAKE AREA SEVERAL EXITS AND STRETCHES OF FEEDER ROAD ARE FLOODED WITH CARS STRANDED RAINFALL TOTALS SO FAR THIS EVENING INCLUDE COWERT CREEK AT BAKER ROAD INCHES CLEAR CREEK AT BAY AREA BLVD INCHES CHIGGER CREEK AT WINDSONG INCHES CLOVER FIELD PEARLAND INCHES NWS OFFICE IN LEAGUE CITY INCHES CLEAR CREEK AT US INCHES BERRY BAYOU AT NEVADA INCHES HOBBY AIRPORT INCHES SUGARLAND INCHES THE CORRIDOR OF HEAVIEST RAIN HAS FALLEN FROM SOUTH OF HOBBY AIRPORT TO LEAGUE CITYBETWEEN I AND STATE HIGHWAY RAINFALL TOTALS OF TO INCHES HAVE BEEN COMMON IN THESE AREAS SMALL CREEKSSTREAMSBAYOUSUNDERPASSESAND FEEDER ROADS MAY FLOOD QUICKLY AVOID LOCATIONS WATER COVERS THE GROUND PLEASE REPORT FLOODING TO THE COUNTY SHERIFFLOCAL POLICEOR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY THEY WILL RELAY YOUR REPORT TO THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LATLON

SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING UNTIL AM CT FRIDAY JUNE FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HOUSTONGALVESTON TX AM CDT FRI JUN THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS ISSUED A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR GALVESTON COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS HARRIS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS UNTIL AM CDT AT AM CDTDOPPLER RADAR INDICATED A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM MILES SOUTH OF SANTA FEMOVING NORTHEAST AT MPH LOCATIONS IN THE PATH OF THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM INCLUDE LA MARQUELEAGUE CITY TEXAS CITYDICKINSONWEBSTER NASSAU BAY BACLIFFKEMAH WINDS IN EXCESS OF MPH ARE VERY LIKELY IN LEAGUE CITY AND DICKINSN MOVE TO AN INTERIOR ROOM ON THE LOWEST FLOOR OF YOUR HOME OR BUSINESS STAY AWAY FROM WINDOWS STRONG WINDS MAY KNOCK DOWN TREES AND POWER LINES OR DAMAGE BUILDINGS TAKE COVER NOW PLEASE REPORT SEVERE WEATHER TO THE COUNTY SHERIFFLOCAL POLICE OR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY THEY WILL RELAY YOUR REPORT TO THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LATLON

FLASH FLOOD WARNING UNTIL AM CT THURSDAY JUNE FOR FLASH FLOOD WARNING NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HOUSTONGALVESTON TX AM CDT THU JUN THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS ISSUED A FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR HARRIS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS FORT BEND COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS UNTIL AM CDT AT AM CDTDOPPLER RADAR INDICATED HEAVY RAINFALL OCCURRING ACROSS AN AREA FROM ORCHARD AND FULSHEAR TO SUGARLAND TO BELLAIRE RAINFALL OF TO INCHES HAS FALLEN SINCE AM IN THESE LOCATIONS FLOODING IS EXPECTED IN OR NEAR SUGARLANDPECAN GROVESUGARLANDTOWN WESTMISSION BEND BELLAIRE EXTENSIVE FLOODING OF FEEDER ROADS HAVE BEEN REPORTED ALONG US IN THE SUGARLAND AREA SMALL CREEKSSTREAMSBAYOUSUNDERPASSESAND FEEDER ROADS MAY FLOOD QUICKLY DO NOT CROSS ANY LOCATION WHERE WATER COVERS THE ROAD EXTENSIVE FLOODING IS OCCURRING TAKE IMMEDIATE ACTION TO PROTECT YOUR LIFE AND PROPERTY IF YOU LIVE IN THESE AREAS PLEASE REPORT FLOODING TO THE COUNTY SHERIFFLOCAL POLICEOR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY THEY WILL RELAY YOUR REPORT TO THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LATLON

FLASH FLOOD WARNING UNTIL AM CT THURSDAY JUNE FOR FLASH FLOOD WARNING NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HOUSTONGALVESTON TX AM CDT THU JUN THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS ISSUED A FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR HARRIS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS FORT BEND COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS UNTIL AM CDT AT AM CDTDOPPLER RADAR INDICATED VERY HEAVY RAINFALL ASSOCIATED WITH A STATIONARY FEEDER BAND FROM NEAR ORCHARD TO RICHMOND TO SUGARLAND TO BELLAIRE TO CHANNELVIEW RADAR ESTIMATES SHOW TO INCHES AS HAVING FALLEN IN THIS CORRIDOR MAINLY OVER FORT BEND COUNTY FLOODING IS EXPECTED IN OR NEAR BARRETTBAYTOWNBELLAIREBUNKER HILL VILLAGERICHMOND AND ALONG THE HIGHWAY CORRIDORESPECIALLY FEEDER ROADS ADDITIONAL HEAVY RAINFALL OF TO INCHES WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG THIS AREA SMALL CREEKSSTREAMSBAYOUSUNDERPASSESAND FEEDER ROADS MAY FLOOD QUICKLY AVOID LOCATIONS WATER COVERS THE GROUND USE EXTRA CAUTION AT NIGHT WHEN IT IS HARDER TO RECOGNIZE THE DEPTH AND SPEED OF FLASH FLOOD WATERS PLEASE REPORT FLOODING TO THE COUNTY SHERIFFLOCAL POLICEOR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY THEY WILL RELAY YOUR REPORT TO THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LATLON

FLASH FLOOD WARNING UNTIL AM CT SATURDAY JUNE FOR FLASH FLOOD WARNING NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HOUSTONGALVESTON TX PM CDT FRI JUN THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS EXTENDED THE FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR HARRIS COUNTY IN SOUTHEAST TEXAS UNTIL AM CDT THIS IS A VERY DANGEROUS FLOOD SITUATION MAJOR ROAD FLOODING IS OCCURRING OVER MANY PARTS OF THE HOUSTON METROPOLITAN AREA AT PM CDTDOPPLER RADAR INDICATED VERY HEAVY RAINFALL CONTINUING OVER MOST OF HARRIS COUNTY THREE HOUR RADAR RAINFALL ESTIMATES EXCEEDED INCHES FROM CHANNEL VIEW SOUTH TO NEAR HIGHWAY MUCH OF HOUSTON INSIDE LOOP HAS HAD TO INCHES OF RAINFALL MORE IS ON THE WAY HEAVY THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO DEVELOP OVER FORT BEND NORTHERN BRAZORIA COUNTY THEN MOVE NORTHEAST AND MERGE WITH THE RAIN OVER HARRIS COUNTY EXPECT AT LEAST TO MORE INCHES OF RAIN BY PM FLOODING IS OCCURRING AT MANY LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT HARRIS COUNTY IF AT ALL POSSIBLEDO NOT TRAVEL IN HARRIS COUNTY UNTIL THIS FLOOD THREAT HAS PASSED SMALL CREEKSSTREAMSBAYOUSUNDERPASSESAND FEEDER ROADS MAY FLOOD QUICKLY AVOID LOCATIONS WATER COVERS THE GROUND USE EXTRA CAUTION AT NIGHT WHEN IT IS HARDER TO RECOGNIZE THE DEPTH AND SPEED OF FLASH FLOOD WATERS PLEASE REPORT FLOODING TO THE COUNTY SHERIFFLOCAL POLICEOR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY THEY WILL RELAY YOUR REPORT TO THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LATLON
